text:
="preserve">Chang Ch'un (May 9,1889-December 14,1990) was Premier of the Republic of China in 1947-1948 and Secretary-General of the Presidency from 1954 to 1972.
In the "pinyin" system invented by the People's Republic of China after the ROC government had moved to Taiwan his name is rendered "Zhang Qun".
He is the longest-lived person to have been Premier of the ROC.
Before he held that office he was Governor of Szechwan (Sichuan).
